result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius Alfonso Coleman

records.addlTxt: Letter to the Court regarding Defendant's Speedy Disposition received and filed.  bm
Request for Prompt Disposition Received 10-25-22.pdf, Filed.
Defense requests an adjourned date for motion hearing.  Court grants request.  All parties agree to new court date.
Letter to the court regarding motions, Filed.
Latter to the court, Filed.
Defendant Letter to the court, Filed.

Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons  in court for Julius Alfonso Coleman.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Julius Alfonso Coleman.  Prosecuting attorney Chad Wozniak in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Discovery has been received by defense, which needs to be discussed between parties.  Defense is requesting dates for motion hearing, final pretrial and jury trial.  The Court advised parties any motions should be filed by 10/7, reply/response due 10/21.  Any pretrial motions are to be filed 48 hours in advance of the date of final pretrial.  mn
Motion hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Received and Filed

Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons appeared in Court for defendant.  Attorney Fitzsimmons has agreed to accept this case and is requesting an adjourned date for scheduling to assure she has all Discovery.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson and attorney William Hotchkiss.   Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties in court on defense motion to withdraw.  Statements made.  The Court finds Good Cause and vacated the Speedy Trial and GRANTED the motion to withdraw.   Case is adjourned for scheduling in Br 45.  mn  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defense Motion to Withdraw, Filed.

Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson and attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness is not available to appear in court for scheduled motion hearing.  This matter is adjourned in Br 45.  The Court ordered counsels to appear with defendant to discuss this matter.   mn  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
EXHIBIT 1 - State's Response to Defense Motion to Exclude Expert Testimony.pdf, Filed.
EXHIBIT 1 - State's Response to Defense Motion to Exclude Expert Testimony.pdf, Filied.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Exclude State's Expert Witness Testimony at Trial, filed.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in custody, CJF.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense challenging DNA report and will file motion by 7.8.22; response due 7.29.22.   Defendant in agreement to extend speedy trial demand to adjourned trial date.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF INTENT TO USE DNA EVIDENCE AT TRIAL
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB
expires 8.31

Attorney Fred Richardson and Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman not in court, in custody, CJF.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in court by video with Attorney Fred Richardson who appears in person.  Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in custody.  Jennifer Tate & John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Ryan Bergemann. Court took judicial notice of 11CF2753. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Julius Alfonso Coleman in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Julius Alfonso Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
